desc: Does the answer discuss key mutability and size differences between HashMap and singletonMap?

subitems.desc: The answer should state that a singletonMap is immutable. 1 point should be deducted if it is not mentioned
The answer should state that a HashMap is mutable. 1 point should be deducted if it is not mentioned
The answer should state that a singletonMap returns only a single key-value mapping. 1 point should be deducted if it is not mentioned.
The answer should mention the message signature of messageParams. 1 point should be deducted if it is not mentioned.
The answer should state that messageParams takes a HashMap. If the answer states that it requires a mutable map, this is not specific enough. 1 point should be deducted if it is not mentioned.

The answer should discuss usages of the map argument within messageParams, noting that these are read-only. 1 point should be deducted if this is not discussed, or if the answer fails to clearly determine whether the usages modify the map or not.
If the answer incorrectly states that the usages of the map argument to messageParams modify it, 2 points should be deducted.
